[[Image:Efez Celsus Library 3 RB.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Personification]] of wisdom (in [[Greek Language|Greek]], "''Σοφία''" or "''Sophia''") at the [[Celsus Library]] in [[Ephesos]], [[Turkey]].]]
    −
'''Wisdom''' is philosophical or scientific learning, insight into others' inner qualities and the nature of human relationships, and generally good sense or judgment. Wisdom is basically knowing things, like the King Soloman, who knew everything about everything. Wisdom is the ability to talk to people about things they enjoy, like say birdwatching. If they say they love how cranes clean their necks, you would know what that meant. <ref> ''Wisdom''. Merriam-Webster Dictionary</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
+
'''Wisdom''' is philosophical or scientific learning, insight into others' inner qualities and the nature of human relationships, and generally good sense or judgment.<ref> ''Wisdom''. Merriam-Webster Dictionary</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
     
Some see wisdom as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources. Some define wisdom in a [[utilitarian]] sense, as foreseeing consequences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
 
Some see wisdom as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources. Some define wisdom in a [[utilitarian]] sense, as foreseeing consequences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
